headline: Gov. DeWine halts purchase, sale of Russian Standard Vodka, announces Day of Prayer for Ukraine
author: Riley Phillips
sentences:
“You know-maybe this will help and maybe it will bring more spirit in America to say we drink our own.”
The Ohio Division of Liquor Control directed retailers to immediately pull those brands from their shelves.
“I think what they are doing is a making a statement to say ‘Hey Russia, you shouldn’t be doing things that you’re tampering in,'” Dramschak said.
The owner Mike Dramschak said they don’t sell Russian vodka as they make their own, but they hope this can boost business for Ohio distilleries.
DeWine also directed the Ohio Department of Commerce to stop the purchase and sale of all vodka made by Russian Standard until further notice.
The governor declared Sunday, February 27, 2022, a statewide Day of Prayer for the people of Ukraine following the invasion of Russia.
The DOLC estimates there are approximately 6,400 bottles made by Russian Standard currently for sale in Ohio.
COLUMBUS, Ohio (WDTN) — Governor Mike DeWine is showing his support and solidarity with Ukraine.
Russian Standard is the only overseas, Russian-owned vodka distillery with vodka sold in Ohio.
All other brands of vodka sold in Ohio are purchased from distilleries not located in Russia.
Russian Standard is sold under the brand names Green Mark Vodka and Russian Standard Vodka.
The Ukraine flag will also fly at the Ohio Statehouse and Governor’s Mansion.
2NEWS spoke with the owner of White Dog Distilling Co. in Middletown.
